statement:
presented in 1908 a conjecture known as *Lindelöf hypothesis* which
concerns the of the Riemann zeta function on the “critical line”
$x = \frac{1}{2}$. Up to now (2015), this hypothesis has not been
proved. It is weaker than the Riemann hypothesis such that this latter
implies it but not conversely.\
**Lindelöf hypothesis.** $\zeta(\frac{1}{2}\!+\!it) 
\;=\; O(t^\varepsilon)$ for every $\varepsilon > 0$ when $t \to \infty$.

Here $O$ is the Landau notation.

[8]{} : “Quelques remarques sur la croissance de la fonction
$\zeta(s)$”. –*Bull. Sci. Math.* **32** (1908).
